newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest hogs called mostly steady-weak- trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest hogs called mostly steady-weak- trade.

text.p: Midwest direct cash hogs were expected to trade mostly steady to lower Friday as some meat packing plants have cancelled plans to slaughter hogs Saturday, cash livestock dealers said.
In addition to cancelling Saturday's slaughter, some packer buyers in Iowa and Minnesota said enough hogs were bought Thursday to satisfy Friday's slaughter needs and part of Monday's.
Illinois dealers expect steady hog prices Friday because of light marketings there this week. Farmers are concentrating on the corn harvest rather than selling of hogs, they said.
However, Ohio sources said light hog marketings there this week should prompt at least $0.50 higher bids Friday.
USDA reported Thursday's hog slaughter at 368,000 head versus 371,000 a week ago and 364,000 a year ago.
